TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SubjectIdentifier extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The SubjectIdentifier class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a or a . The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number or the subject key.
The Type property retrieves the type of subject identifier. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number or the subject key.
Docs.value: A member of the enumeration that identifies the type of subject.
Docs.returns: A member of the enumeration that identifies the type of subject.

Docs.summary: The Value property retrieves the value of the subject identifier. Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type%2A> property to determine the type of subject identifier, and use the Value property to retrieve the corresponding value.
Docs.value:
An <xref:System.Object> object that represents the value of the subject identifier. This <xref:System.Object> can be one of the following objects as determined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type%2A> property.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type%2A> property
Object
IssuerAndSerialNumber
SubjectKeyIdentifier
<xref:System.String>
Docs.returns:
An <xref:System.Object> object that represents the value of the subject identifier. This <xref:System.Object> can be one of the following objects as determined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type%2A> property.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type%2A> property
